      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L24" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="24"></td>
        <td id="LC24" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mh"><span class="pl-mh">#</span><span class="pl-mh"> </span>Cancensus and CensusMapper</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L25" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="25"></td>
        <td id="LC25" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L26" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="26"></td>
        <td id="LC26" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> package was developed to provide users with a way to access Canadian Census in a programmatic way following good [<span class="pl-e">tidy data</span>](http://vita.had.co.nz/papers/tidy-data.pdf) practices. While the structure and data in <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> is unique to Canadian Census data, this package is inspired in part by [<span class="pl-e">tidycensus</span>](https://github.com/walkerke/tidycensus), a package to interface with the US Census Bureau data APIs. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L27" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="27"></td>
        <td id="LC27" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L28" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="28"></td>
        <td id="LC28" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">As Statistics Canada does not provide direct API access to Census data, <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> retrieves Census data indirectly through the [<span class="pl-e">CensusMapper</span>](https://censusmapper.ca) API. CensusMapper is a project by [<span class="pl-e">Jens von Bergmann</span>](https://twitter.com/vb_jens), one of the authors of <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span>, to provide interactive geographic visualizations of Canadian Census data. CensusMapper databases store all publicly available data from Statistics Canada for the 2006, 2011, and 2016 Censuses. Censusmapper data can be accessed via an API and <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> is built to interface directly with it. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L29" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="29"></td>

</td>

        <td id="LC30" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mh"><span class="pl-mh">##</span><span class="pl-mh"> </span>API Key</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L31" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="31"></td>
        <td id="LC31" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L32" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="32"></td>
        <td id="LC32" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> requires a valid CensusMapper API key to use. You can obtain a free API key by [<span class="pl-e">signing up</span>](https://censusmapper.ca/users/sign_up) for a CensusMapper account. CensusMapper API keys are free and public API quotas are generous; however, due to incremental costs of serving large quantities of data, there limits to API usage in place. For most use cases, these API limits should not be an issue. Production uses with large extracts of fine grained geographies may run into API quota limits. For larger quotas, please get in touch with Jens [<span class="pl-e">directly</span>](mailto:jens@censusmapper.ca).  </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L33" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="33"></td>
        <td id="LC33" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L34" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="34"></td>
        <td id="LC34" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">To check your API key, just go to &quot;Edit Profile&quot; (in the top-right of the CensusMapper menu bar). Once you have your key, you can store it in your system environment so it is automatically used in API calls. To do so just enter <span class="pl-c1">`options(cancensus.api_key = &quot;your_api_key&quot;)`</span>.</td>
      </tr>

        <td id="LC35" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>

</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L38" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="38"></td>
        <td id="LC38" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The stable version of <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> can be easily installed from CRAN.</td>

</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L48" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="48"></td>
        <td id="LC48" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Alternatively, the latest development version can be installed from Github using <span class="pl-c1">`devtools`</span>. </td>

        <td id="LC53" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1">library(<span class="pl-smi">cancensus</span>)</span></td>

        <td id="LC56" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1">options(<span class="pl-v">cancensus.cache_path</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">&quot;</span>custom cache path<span class="pl-pds">&quot;</span></span>)</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L57" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="57"></td>
        <td id="LC57" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1"></span><span class="pl-c1">```</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L58" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="58"></td>
        <td id="LC58" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L59" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="59"></td>
        <td id="LC59" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">For performance reasons, and to avoid unnecessarily drawing down API quotas, <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> caches data queries under the hood. By default, <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> caches in R&#39;s temporary directory, but this cache is not persistent across sessions. In order to speed up performance, reduce quota usage, and reduce the need for unnecessary network calls, we recommend assigning a persistent local cache using <span class="pl-c1">`options(cancensus.cache_path = &#39;XXX&#39;)`</span>, this enables better control over the data. Users will be prompted with a suggestion to change their default cache location when making API calls if one has not been set yet. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L60" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="60"></td>
        <td id="LC60" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L61" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="61"></td>
        <td id="LC61" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Setting the API key and the cache path in the <span class="pl-c1">`.Rprofile`</span> facilitates the ability to share code without exposing API keys or relying on the local directory structure. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L62" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="62"></td>
        <td id="LC62" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L63" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="63"></td>
        <td id="LC63" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mh"><span class="pl-mh">#</span><span class="pl-mh"> </span>Accessing Census Data</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L64" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="64"></td>
        <td id="LC64" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L65" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="65"></td>
        <td id="LC65" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> provides three different functions for retrieving Census data:</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L66" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="66"></td>
        <td id="LC66" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> <span class="pl-c1">`get_census`</span> to retrieve Census data and geography as a spatial dataset</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L67" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="67"></td>
        <td id="LC67" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> <span class="pl-c1">`get_census_data`</span> to retrieve Census data only as a flat data frame</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L68" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="68"></td>
        <td id="LC68" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> <span class="pl-c1">`get_census_geometry`</span> to retrieve Census geography only as a collection of spatial polygons.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L69" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="69"></td>
        <td id="LC69" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L70" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="70"></td>
        <td id="LC70" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-c1">`get_census`</span> takes as inputs a dataset parameter, a list of specified regions, a vector of Census variables, and a Census geography level. You can specify one of three options for spatial formats: <span class="pl-c1">`NA`</span> to return data only, <span class="pl-c1">`sf`</span> to return an sf-class data frame, or <span class="pl-c1">`sp`</span> to return a SpatialPolygonsDataFrame object. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

        <td id="LC71" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L84" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="84"></td>
        <td id="LC84" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-smi">census_data</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> get_census(<span class="pl-v">dataset</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">&#39;</span>CA16<span class="pl-pds">&#39;</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">regions</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">CMA</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">&quot;</span>59933<span class="pl-pds">&quot;</span></span>),</span></td>

        <td id="LC86" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1">                          <span class="pl-v">level</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">&#39;</span>CSD<span class="pl-pds">&#39;</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">use_cache</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">FALSE</span>, <span class="pl-v">geo_format</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">&#39;</span>sp<span class="pl-pds">&#39;</span></span>)</span></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L87" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="87"></td>
        <td id="LC87" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1"></span><span class="pl-c1">```</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L88" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="88"></td>
        <td id="LC88" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L89" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="89"></td>
        <td id="LC89" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> utilizes caching to increase speed, minimize API token usage, and to make data available offline. Downloaded data is hashed and stored locally so if a call is made to access the same data, <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> will read the local version instead. To force <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> to refresh the data, specify <span class="pl-c1">`use_cache = FALSE`</span> as a parameter for <span class="pl-c1">`get_census`</span>. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L90" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="90"></td>
        <td id="LC90" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L91" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="91"></td>
        <td id="LC91" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Additional parameters for advanced options can be viewed by running <span class="pl-c1">`?get_census`</span>.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

      <tr>

</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L95" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="95"></td>
        <td id="LC95" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> can access Statistics Canada Census data for Census years 1996, 2001, 2006, 2011, and 2016 . You can run <span class="pl-c1">`list_census_datasets`</span> to check what datasets are currently available for access through the CensusMapper API. Additional data for the 2016 Census will be included in Censusmapper within a day or two after public release by Statistics Canada. Statistics Canada maintains a release schedule for the Census 2016 Program which can be viewed on their [<span class="pl-e">website</span>](http://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/2016/ref/release-dates-diffusion-eng.cfm).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L96" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="96"></td>
        <td id="LC96" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L97" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="97"></td>
        <td id="LC97" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Thanks to contributions by the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC), <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> now includes additional Census-linked datasets as open-data releases. These include annual taxfiler data at the census tract level for tax years 2000 through 2017, which includes data on incomes and demographics, as well as specialized crosstabs for Structural type of dwelling by Document type, which details occupancy status for residences. These crosstabs are available for the 2001, 2006, 2011, and 2016 Census years at all levels starting with census tract.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L98" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="98"></td>
        <td id="LC98" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L99" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="99"></td>
        <td id="LC99" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The function <span class="pl-c1">`list_census_datasets()`</span> will show all available datasets alongside their metadata.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L100" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="100"></td>
        <td id="LC100" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>

      <tr>
        <td id="L105" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="105"></td>
        <td id="LC105" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">As other Census datasets become available via the CensusMapper API, they will be listed as output when calling <span class="pl-c1">`list_census_datasets()`</span>. </td>
      </tr>

</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L109" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="109"></td>
        <td id="LC109" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Census data is aggregated at multiple [<span class="pl-e">geographic levels</span>](### Census Geographic Levels). Census geographies at the national (C), provincial (PR), census metropolitan area (CMA), census agglomeration (CA), census division (CD), and census subdivision (CSD) are defined as named census regions. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L110" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="110"></td>
        <td id="LC110" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L111" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="111"></td>
        <td id="LC111" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Canadian Census geography can change in between Census periods. <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> provides a function, <span class="pl-c1">`list_census_regions(dataset)`</span>, to display all named census regions and their corresponding id for a given census dataset. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L112" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="112"></td>
        <td id="LC112" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>

      </tr>

        <td id="LC115" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1"></span><span class="pl-c1">```</span></td>

You can combine different regions together into region lists.</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L131" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="131"></td>
        <td id="LC131" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Census data accessible through <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> comes is available in a number of different aggregation levels including: </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L132" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="132"></td>
        <td id="LC132" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L133" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="133"></td>
        <td id="LC133" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| Code    | Description                    | Count in Census 2016 |</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L134" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="134"></td>
        <td id="LC134" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| --------|--------------------------------|:--------------------:|</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L135" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="135"></td>
        <td id="LC135" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| C       | Canada (total)                 | 1                    |</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

        <td id="LC136" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| PR      | Provinces/Territories          | 13                   |</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L137" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="137"></td>
        <td id="LC137" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| CMA     | Census Metropolitan Area       | 35                   |</td>
      </tr>

        <td id="LC141" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| CT      | Census Tracts                  | 5621                 |</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L142" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="142"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L143" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="143"></td>
        <td id="LC143" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">| EA      | Enumeration Area (1996 only)   | -                    |</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

      </tr>

      </tr>
      <tr>

        <td id="LC146" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L147" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="147"></td>
        <td id="LC147" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Selecting <span class="pl-c1">`regions = &quot;59933&quot;`</span> and <span class="pl-c1">`level = &quot;CT&quot;`</span> will return data for all 478 census tracts in the Vancouver Census Metropolitan Area. Selecting <span class="pl-c1">`level = &quot;DA&quot;`</span> will return data for all 3450 dissemination areas and selecting <span class="pl-c1">`level = &quot;DB&quot;`</span> will retrieve data for 15,197 dissemination block. Working with CT, DA, EA, and especially DB level data significantly increases the size of data downloads and API usage. To help minimize additional overhead, <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> supports local data caching to reduce usage and load times. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L148" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="148"></td>
        <td id="LC148" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L149" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="149"></td>
        <td id="LC149" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Setting <span class="pl-c1">`level = &quot;Regions&quot;`</span> will produce data strictly for the selected region without any tiling of data at lower census aggregation levels levels. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L150" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="150"></td>
        <td id="LC150" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>

</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L153" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="153"></td>
        <td id="LC153" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Census data contains thousands of different geographic regions as well as thousands of unique variables. In addition to enabling programmatic and reproducible access to Census data, <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> has a number of tools to help users find the data they are looking for. </td>
      </tr>

</td>
      </tr>

      <tr>
        <td id="L157" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="157"></td>
        <td id="LC157" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Run <span class="pl-c1">`list_census_vectors(dataset)`</span> to view all available Census variables for a given dataset. </td>
      </tr>

        <td id="LC168" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> Type: variables are provided as aggregates of female responses, male responses, or total (male+female) responses</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L169" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="169"></td>
        <td id="LC169" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> Label: detailed variable name</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L170" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="170"></td>
        <td id="LC170" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> Units: provides information about whether the variable represents a count integer, a ratio, a percentage, or a currency figure</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

        <td id="LC171" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> Parent_vector: shows the immediate hierarchical parent category for that variable, where appropriate</td>

        <td id="LC172" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> Aggregation: indicates how the variable should be aggregated with others, whether it is additive or if it is an average of another variable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L173" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="173"></td>
        <td id="LC173" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-v">*</span> Description: a rough description of a variable based on its hierarchical structure. This is constructed by <span class="pl-mb">**cancensus**</span> by recursively traversing the labels for every variable&#39;s hierarchy, and facilitates searching for specific variables using key terms. </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L174" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="174"></td>
        <td id="LC174" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L175" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="175"></td>
        <td id="LC175" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mh"><span class="pl-mh">##</span><span class="pl-mh"> </span>Variable search</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L176" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="176"></td>
        <td id="LC176" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L177" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="177"></td>
        <td id="LC177" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Each Census dataset features numerous variables making it a bit of a challenge to find the exact variable you are looking for. There is a function, <span class="pl-c1">`find_census_vectors()`</span>, for searching through Census variable metadata in a few different ways. There are three types of searches possible using this function: exact search, which simply looks for exact string matches for a given query against the vector dataset; keyword search, which breaks vector metadata into unigram tokens and then tries to find the vectors with the greatest number of unique matches; and, semantic search which works better with search phrases and has tolerance for inexact searches. Switching between search modes is done using the <span class="pl-c1">`query_type`</span> argument when calling <span class="pl-c1">`find_census_variables()`</span> function. </td>
      </tr>

        <td id="LC190" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Census variables are frequently hierarchical. As an example, consider the variable for the number of people of Austrian ethnic background. We can select that vector and quickly look up its entire hierarchy using <span class="pl-c1">`parent_census_vectors`</span> on a vector list.  </td>

      </tr>

</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L198" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="198"></td>
        <td id="LC198" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sometimes we want to traverse the hierarchy in the opposite direction. This is frequently required when looking to compare different variable stems that share the same aggregate variable. As an example, if we want to look the total count of Northern European ethnic origin respondents disaggregated by individual countries, it is pretty easy to do so. </td>
      </tr>
